e4: While transitioning to an unbiased reporting policy might cause initial market confusion and short-term investor anxiety due to unfamiliarity, it ultimately fosters trust and transparency.  Long-term, this ethical stance strengthens the company's reputation, reduces legal risks, and attracts ethically-minded investors.
e5: An ethical reporting policy prioritizes accuracy and transparency above all else. It clearly reflects a company's true financial performance without manipulation or deliberate omission of information, even if it presents unfavorable outcomes.  It also fosters trust with investors by being consistent, readily understandable, and adhering to regulatory standards.
e6: Yes. I would ask about their plan for communicating the policy change to investors, addressing investor concerns, and ensuring a smooth transition.  I'd also inquire about potential strategies to educate retail investors on the new policy and mitigate any potential disadvantage they might face.
